Detailed Description

MPEG-4 Simple Profile and H.263 Baseline video encoder interface for the sciCOS 3020.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

Destructor

Member Function Documentation

CodecManager::ResultType ScicosMpeg4VideoEncoder::AllocateOutputBuffers (  UINT8 HUGE **&  out_buf_array,
UINT8 &  out_buf_count,
UINT32 &  out_buf_len
)  [virtual]
 

Allocates a number of output buffers that are used to store the encoded frames.

Parameters:
out_buf_array On return, a pointer to the output buffer array (the elements of the array are pointers to the actual buffers).
out_buf_count Desired number of buffers to be allocated in the output buffer array. If set to 0, the default number of buffers will be allocated. On return, the actual number of buffers, i.e. the ScicosMpeg4VideoEncoder adapt the number passed in by the caller if necessary.
out_buf_len Desired length (in bytes) of one output buffer (all buffers have the same length). If set to 0, the default length will be used. On return, the actual buffer length, i.e. the ScicosMpeg4VideoEncoder adapt the length passed in by the caller if necessary.
Returns:
CodecManager::Success if the operation was successful. Otherwise, an appropriate error code.

CodecManager::ResultType ScicosMpeg4VideoEncoder::EncodeFrame (  UINT8 HUGE *  in_buf,
UINT32  in_buf_len,
UINT32  time_stamp,
UINT32  key_frame_ind,
UINT8 HUGE *  out_buf
)  [virtual]
 

Encodes a video frame. This is done asynchronously, i.e., when the frame has been encoded, the callback function CbVideoFrameEncoded will be invoked.

Parameters:
in_buf Points to input raw video data.
in_buf_len Length of the input raw video data in_buf (in bytes).
time_stamp Number of primary time units elapsed since the start of encoding process. Time stamp value should be integral multiple of ScicosMpeg4VideoEncoderParameters::timer_resolution/ScicosMpeg4VideoEncoderParametersframe_rate (refer the details on ScicosMpeg4VideoEncoderParameters).
key_frame_ind Flag indicating the insertion of I-frame. Possible values for this flag are: TRUE, FALSE. TRUE inserts the I-frame. Default value should be FALSE.
out_buf Buffer in which the encoded stream needs to be written. Enough buffer to hold the encoded stream corresponding to one frame of data should be given. The maximum frame size (i.e. encoding bytes) can be obtained by using GetParameter function.
Returns:
CodecManager::Success if the operation was successful. Otherwise, an appropriate error code.
See also:
CbFrameEncoded

CodecManager::ResultType ScicosMpeg4VideoEncoder::GetCapabilities (  CodecManager::VideoCodecCapabilities &  caps  )  [virtual]
 

This function is used to retrieve the capabilities of the video encoder (VideoEncoder sub-class).

Parameters:
caps On return, it contains the capabilities. Note: The caller has to create this object (with arbitrary values) before calling this function. The passed object is then filled with the correct values by the VideoDecoder sub-class.
Returns:
CodecManager::Success if the operation was successful. Otherwise, an appropriate error code.

CodecManager::ResultType ScicosMpeg4VideoEncoder::GetConfigStream (  UINT8 HUGE *  out_buf,
UINT32 &  out_buf_len
)  [virtual]
 

This function is used to get (write) the configuration stream (header) into the specified buffer. The caller has to provide this buffer and ensure that the length of it is sufficient for the config stream.

Parameters:
out_buf Pointer to a buffer where the config stream shall be written to.
out_buf_len Length of the out_buf (in bytes). On return contains the actual length of the filled buffer.
Returns:
CodecManager::Success if the operation was successful. Otherwise, an appropriate error code.

CodecManager::ResultType ScicosMpeg4VideoEncoder::GetParameters (  const ParameterType *  types_array,
UINT32 *  values_array,
UINT8  array_count
)  [virtual]
 

This function retrieves the values of specified parameters in the video encoder.

Parameters:
types_array Array of the parameter types that specify the parameters to be retrieved.
values_array On return, array of the retrieved parameter values. The first element in this array is of type that is specified by the first element of types_array and so on. In general, the values themselves have to be casted to the actual parameter type. The caller has to allocate memory for this array before invoking of this function. The existing elements of the array are then filled with the corresponding parameter values by the video encoder.
array_count Length (number of elements) of the types_array and types_array i.e., both arrays have always the same length.
Returns:
CodecManager::Success if the operation was successful. Otherwise, an appropriate error code.

CodecManager::ResultType ScicosMpeg4VideoEncoder::RegisterCallbackFunctions (  UINT32  context,
CbFrameEncoded  cb_frame_encoded
)  [virtual]
 

Register callback functions.

Parameters:
context A context (e.g. this pointer) that is valid for all callback functions registered with this instance of the ScicosMpeg4VideoEncoder. This context is then passed as an argument of all callback functions invoked by the ScicosMpeg4VideoEncoder.
cb_frame_encoded A pointer to a callback function that is invoked by the ScicosMpeg4VideoEncoder each time when a frame has been encoded.
Returns:
CodecManager::Success if the operation was successful. Otherwise, an appropriate error code.

CodecManager::ResultType ScicosMpeg4VideoEncoder::SetParameters (  const ParameterType *  types_array,
const UINT32 *  values_array,
UINT8  array_count
)  [virtual]
 

Sets dynamically one or more encoder parameters.

Parameters:
types_array Array of the parameter types that specify the parameters to be changed. The corresponding values to be set are delivered in values_array.
values_array Array of the values to which the corresponding parameters have to be set. The first element in this array is of type that is specified by the first element of types_array and so on. In general, the values themselves have to be casted to the actual parameter type.
array_count Length (number of elements) of the types_array and values_array, i.e., both arrays have always the same length.
Returns:
CodecManager::Success if the operation was successful. Otherwise, an appropriate error code.
